conclusion: The plate has a mass M = 2m and the block with mass m is placed gently on the plate with zero initial velocity.
The system accelerates together due to friction between the surfaces involved.
The gravitational force acting on the block is mg.
The normal force on the block from the plate is mg.
The kinetic friction force μ1 mg acts on the block.
The block and plate accelerate together.
The acceleration a1 of the block can be found from the motion graph (Figure B), assume it is obtained as a1.
For the block: f = ma1 = μ1 mg, therefore, a1 = μ1 g.
The given acceleration a1 can be directly related to μ1.
If a1 is determined from the graph, assume a1 = 1 m/s² as a simplified example.
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ1 between the block and the plate is 0.1.
If a1 is different, substitute the actual value from the graph into the equation to find μ1.
